pullRequest.body:
This PR removes the last few instances of the backward compatability option `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false`.

To achieve this, the `simp` tag from `Disjoint.of_image_finset` is removed, which I think shouldn't have been a simp lemma in the first place.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [dfd5145f90](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20193/commits/dfd5145f9054fdae685e9b670c819f567065d783)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ unitsMap_val`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (13.00, 13.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|4849|-1|porting notes|
|1|-13|skipAssignedInstances flags|

Current commit [dfd5145f90](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/dfd5145f9054fdae685e9b670c819f567065d783)
Reference commit [2f4156e191](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/2f4156e1918b1bb532f463d6838dd7e1d5715b22)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/cdf93673-df80-4599-b648-64268da4a985) for commit 6f7c232692d983db18317d86789dd770c2f0ae52.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/7e16b46d-feb7-4490-a1c1-82df812351a8/to/cdf93673-df80-4599-b648-64268da4a985) against commit 2f4156e1918b1bb532f463d6838dd7e1d5715b22.
And the report is positive (neutral/slight positive).

The only changed file that slowed down is `Mathlib.Combinatorics.SetFamily.Shadow`, but only by `0,463 %`. It has a really slow `aesop`. This improved a bit by removing that simp lemma. But, looking at the trace, it looks like `aesop` is repeatedly solving the same goals?
Are these bad simp lemmas you found examples of a pattern that could be detected by a linter?

Hmm, it would definitely be possible to check for variables that appear in a subgoal or in the RHS, but not in the LHS. However I don't know if there are simp lemmas that have this property on purpose.

It is in principle possible to instantiate the metavairables in the subgoals, because `simp` allows you to specify a discharger, so it's not necessarily bad to have such simp lemmas. But it's probably better to not have such lemmas in the default simp set.
bors delegate+

:v: JovanGerb can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+
This PR is great *in principle*! Let's check that performance is alright (some of these options were restored for performance reasons) --- I've sent it for benchmarking.
Looks good to me. I would interested in dredging the code for more cases of the pattern you identified here in the `simp` theorems. But that can be left for the future. Thanks!
This PR is great *in principle*! Let's check that performance is alright (some of these options were restored for performance reasons) --- I've sent it for benchmarking.
Looks good to me. I would interested in dredging the code for more cases of the pattern you identified here in the `simp` theorems. But that can be left for the future. Thanks!
Why this change?

It seems a bit of a strange simp lemma to me, since it introduces a metavariable `f` inside of the subgoal `h` that needs to be discharged. And this was slowing down the `simp` in the `aesop` at `mem_shadow_iterate_iff_exists_card`.
Missing lemma?

Yes, there is a missing lemma about `ZMod.unitsMap`:
One can go from `Units (ZMod 10)` to `ZMod 5` either via `ZMod 10` or via `Units (ZMod 5)`. I've added it like this:
```
@[simp]
def val_unitsMap {m n : Nat} (h : n ∣ m) (a : Units (ZMod m)) :
    (ZMod.unitsMap h a).val = (a.val).cast := rfl
```
This works to fix this `simp`, but it is non-confluent in combination with `[MulChar.one_apply_coe](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/NumberTheory/MulChar/Basic.html#MulChar.one_apply_coe)`. This caused the `simp` in `DirichletCharacter.changeLevel` to break down.

But I fixed that `simp` by changing the simp normal form of `MulChar.EquivToUnitHom` to be `MulChar.mulEquivToUnitHom`, so that it simplifies away the 1 more easily.

Similarly here, this lemma introduces a metavariable `φ₁₂` in the rewritten term and in two subgoals that need to be discharged, so it doesn't seem to be a good simp lemma. Should I do this in a separate PR?

pullRequest.title: chore: remove last few instances of `set_option tactic.skipAssignedInstances false`

It is in principle possible to instantiate the metavairables in the subgoals, because `simp` allows you to specify a discharger, so it's not necessarily bad to have such simp lemmas. But it's probably better to not have such lemmas in the default simp set.
